00007 namespace Pandora

00009     //A simple vector class.
00010     template<class T>
00011     class Vector
00012     {
00013         public:
00014             Vector(const size_t size = 1, const size_t inc = 1);
00015             ~Vector();
00016 
00017             //Get a pointer to the data
00018             T* c_ptr();
00019             const T* c_ptr() const;
00020 
00021             //Get element number i from the data. No resizing done
00022             T& operator[](const size_t i);
00023             const T& operator[](const size_t i) const;
00024 
00025             //Append data to the vector
00026             void append(const T& element);
00027             void insert(const size_t i, const T& element);
00028 
00029             //Remove elements, do not delete.
00030             T& remove(const size_t i);
00031             void removeAll();
00032 
00033             //Get the number of elements, the maximum number of elements in 
00034             //the vector and the number to increase the array with.
00035             size_t getElements() const;
00036             size_t getSize() const;
00037             size_t getIncrement() const;
00038 
00039             //Change the size or the number to increase with.
00040             void setSize(const size_t size);
00041             void setIncrement(const size_t inc);
00042         protected:
00043             T *m_data;
00044             size_t m_elements;
00045             size_t m_size;
00046             size_t m_increment;
00047     };
00048 
00049     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00050     // Constructor
00051     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00052     template<class T>
00053     Vector<T>::Vector(const size_t size, const size_t inc)
00054     {
00055         m_size = size;
00056         m_increment = inc;
00057         m_elements = 0;
00058         m_data = new T[m_size];
00059     }
00060 
00061     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00062     // Destructor
00063     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00064     template<class T>
00065     Vector<T>::~Vector()
00066     {
00067         delete[] m_data;
00068     }
00069 
00070     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00071     // Get a c-pointer
00072     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00073     template<class T>
00074     T* Vector<T>::c_ptr()
00075     {
00076         return m_data[0];
00077     }
00078 
00079     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00080     // Get a constant c-pointer
00081     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00082     template<class T>
00083     const T* Vector<T>::c_ptr() const
00084     {
00085         return m_data[0];
00086     }

00088     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00089     // Access element number i
00090     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00091     template<class T>
00092     T& Vector<T>::operator[](const size_t i)
00093     {
00094         assert(i < m_size && "Index out of bounds");
00095 
00096         return m_data[i];
00097     }
00098 
00099     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00100     // Access constant element number i.
00101     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00102     template<class T>
00103     const T& Vector<T>::operator[](const size_t i) const
00104     {
00105         assert(i < m_size && "Index out of bounds");
00106         return m_data[i];
00107     }
00108 
00109     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00110     // Set this element to the first free element in the vector.
00111     //
00112     // If we have free places, we add to the first free place we find. If we 
00113     // have a full array, we make a new array which is size + increment large. 
00114     // then we move all the data to the new vector, and add the new element to 
00115     // the end of the vector.
00116     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00117     template<class T>
00118     void Vector<T>::append(const T& element)
00119     {
00120         if(m_elements < m_size) {
00121             m_data[m_elements++] = m_elements;
00122         } else {
00123             assert(m_increment != 0 && "Can't increment the vector");
00124 
00125             T *tmp = new T[m_size + m_increment];
00126 
00127             //Move data to the temporary array
00128             for(size_t i = 0; i < m_size; ++i) {
00129                 tmp[i] = m_data[i];
00130             }
00131 
00132             delete[] m_data;
00133 
00134             m_data = tmp;
00135             m_data[m_elements++] = element;
00136             m_size += m_increment;
00137         }
00138     }
00139 
00140     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00141     // Inserts the element into the given place. If the place is unused, or we
00142     // are accessing an element outside of the data, we increment the unmber of
00143     // elements we have.
00144     //
00145     // If we have to resize the array, we do that by first finding out how many
00146     // more elements we need, and then copying the data over to a new array.
00147     //
00148     // At the end, we set the given place to be the element we sent in.
00149     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00150     template<class T>
00151     void Vector<T>::insert(const size_t i, const T& element)
00152     {
00153         if(i > m_size || m_data[i])
00154             ++m_elements;
00155         
00156         if(i > m_size) {
00157             size_t times = i - m_size;
00158             times = (int) (((float)times / m_increment) + 0.5f);
00159             T *tmp = new T[m_size + m_increment*times];
00160 
00161             for(size_t j = 0; j < m_size; ++j) {
00162                 tmp[j] = m_data[j];
00163             }
00164 
00165             delete[] m_data;
00166             m_data = tmp;
00167             m_size += m_increment * times;
00168         }
00169 
00170         m_data[i] = element;
00171     }
00172 
00173     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00174     // Remove the element in the selected place, and return it.
00175     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00176     template<class T>
00177     T& Vector<T>::remove(const size_t i)
00178     {
00179         assert(i < m_size && i >= 0 && "Index out of bounds");
00180 
00181         T tmp = m_data[i];
00182         for(size_t j = i; j < m_elements; ++j) {
00183             m_data[j] = m_data[j + 1];
00184         }
00185 
00186         m_data[m_elements--] = T();
00187 
00188         return tmp;
00189     }
00190 
00191     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00192     // Remove all the data from this vector
00193     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00194     template<class T>
00195     void Vector<T>::removeAll()
00196     {
00197         for(size_t i = 0; i < m_elements; ++i) {
00198             m_data[i] = T();
00199         }
00200     }
00201 
00202     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00203     // Return the number of elements in the vector.
00204     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00205     template<class T>
00206     size_t Vector<T>::getElements() const
00207     {
00208         return m_elements;
00209     }
00210 
00211     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00212     // Return the size of the vector.
00213     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00214     template<class T>
00215     size_t Vector<T>::getSize() const
00216     {
00217         return m_size;
00218     }
00219 
00220     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00221     // Returns the number we are to increase the vector with.
00222     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00223     template<class T>
00224     size_t Vector<T>::getIncrement() const
00225     {
00226         return m_increment;
00227     }
00228 
00229     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00230     // Set new size of the vector.
00231     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00232     template<class T>
00233     void Vector<T>::setSize(const size_t size)
00234     {
00235         T *tmp = new T[size];
00236 
00237         for(size_t i = 0; i < m_size && i < size; ++i) {
00238             tmp[i] = m_data[i];
00239         }
00240 
00241         delete[] m_data;
00242         m_data = tmp;
00243         m_size = size;
00244 
00245         if(size < m_elements)
00246             m_elements = size;
00247     }
00248 
00249     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00250     // Set new number of element to increase by.
00251     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00252     template<class T>
00253     void Vector<T>::setIncrement(const size_t inc)
00254     {
00255         m_increment = inc;
00256     }
